result.execSummary:
The defendant Preston K Jobin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to follow through with ANY and ALL recommendations for counseling per Probation

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Preston K Jobin

defendant.name: Jobin, Preston K
defendant.address: 271 9th Avenue South, Lot 30, Park Falls, WI 54552

records.addlTxt:
2:30 PM DA Kelz calls case and states appearances. Prosecuting attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Preston K Jobin in court. DA Kelz states the defendant had entered a guilty plea at his initial appearance and this date was set for Plea and Sentencing in this matter. Court questions defendant on previous plea. Defendant gives responses. Defendant enter s a plea of NO CONTEST. Defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to counsel. DA Kelz states Victim's Rights Legislations have been complied with. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. comments by parties.
Court imposes:

Withheld Sentence- 1 Year Probation 
$300 Fine
$200 DNA + Sample 
Follow through with ANY and ALL counseling recommendations through Probation 


Appeal Rights Given
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): G.A.L unless a written waiver is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office OR with the Price County Sheriff's Department outside of normal business hours. 
 *No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

10:13 AM Defendant Preston K Jobin appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   DE enters plea of GUILTY to all counts. DA Kelz states there is not time in the courts schedule to continue with pleaand sentencing today. DA Kelz gives bond recommendation. Bond ordered as requested.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
